section.p:
This manual is a guide to the system that runs . It covers getting help,
logging in to
and managing profiles, managing groups, and participating online.
There are four ways of getting help at : from the user manual, and from context-sensitive help. from the participation coach in a group, and from Support.

section.h: Getting Help from the User Manual
section.p:
You can access
User Manual from any page on . To access help, carry out the following.

ol.li: Click on Help, in the main menu-bar at the top of every page. The Help page will open.

Click on User Manual.
User Manual will open.

section.p: Help that relates to a particular situation — or context — is avaliable on many pages. To access the context-sensitve help, carry out the following.

ol.li: Locate the link to the context-sensitive help, which looks like [?]. The link will be next to the item that the help applies to.
Click on the help-link. The context-sensitive help will appear on the right of the page. The help may be closed when no longer needed.

section.p:
To view the section of
User Manual that the context-sensitive help comes from, click on Read more at the bottom of the help-window.

section.h: Getting Help from the Participation Coach
section.p: The participation coach is the person responsible for assisting group members with the interaction with each other and . To contact the participation coach, carry out the following tasks.

ol.li: View the group (see Viewing a Group).
View the profile of the participation coach, by clicking on the name of the participation coach, listed in the Members section of the group homepage.
Contact the participation coach, by clicking on the link listed in the Email addresses section of the coache's profile.

section.p: You can get help from Support by sending an email message, detailing your problem, to . Your message should contain a description of exactly what you are doing, what is not happening, and what you think should happen. If possible, supplying the email addresses you use, and your user ID, would be helpful to Support.
Registered users must log in to to use all the facilities. To log in to , carry out the following.

ol.li:
Click on Log In, on
homepage. The Log In page will open.
Type your user name and password into the respective fields.
Click the Log In button. The homepage will be shown, with your user name at the top-right of the page.

section.p: If you select Remember me, your identity will be remembered by , so you will not have to log in next time you visit. However, you should not select this if you are using a shared or public computer, such as a computer in an e-cafe or library, as your privacy may be compromised.
If you forget your password, can send you a new password. Carry out the following to reset your password.

ol.li:
Click on Log In, on
homepage. The Log In page will open.
Click Reset password to open the Reset Password page.
Enter your email address, or your user name, into the Address field.
Click the Reset button. A message, containing a new password, will be sent to all email addresses listed with .
Log in to using your new password (see Logging In to ).

section.p: A profile is information kept by about all users, including you. You can view your profile, change the information stored in your profile and view the profiles of other registered users.
To view your profile, carry out the following.

ol.li:
Log in to
(see Logging In to ).
Click on your user-name, which is displayed at the top-right of every page on .

section.p: Your profile will show the groups that you belong to, the most recent messages that you have posted, and the profile data listed in Profile Information.

tr.td: The name you wish to be known by.
The city or town where you live.
The email addresses that you will use with .
The ID that you use on the Skype network
A small image (thumbnail) that others will see next to messages that you post and on your profile page.
A list of the online groups that you belong to.
The Website for the organisation that you belong to.
The address of a Web page about you.
The language you speak most often.

section.p: Information listed in your profile (see Profile Information) can be changed. How the information is changed depends on the type of data it is: password, text or image. You can also add email addresses to your profile.
To change your password, carry out the following.

ol.li: View your profile (see Viewing Your Profile).
Click Change Password. The Change Password page will appear.
Type the new password in the first entry of the New Password field. (For security reasons, asterisk characters * will appear rather than the characters you type.)
Type the same password in the Repeat New Password field.
Click the Change Password button.

section.p: If the passwords that you typed in do not match, an error message will appear and the password will not be changed.
All fields in your profile, except for the password and image fields, are text fields. Carry out the following, to change a text-field.

ol.li: View your profile (see Viewing Your Profile).
Click Change Profile. The Change Profile page will appear.
Edit the text field, so it reflects the new value.
Click the Change button at the bottom of the page.

section.p: Carry out the following, to change the image that is shown on your profile and placed next to messages you post.

ol.li: View your profile (see Viewing Your Profile).
Click Change Image. The Change Image page will appear.
Click the Browse button, which is next to your image.
Select an image in the file-selector dialog.
Click the Change button at the bottom of the page.

section.p: Images should be 125 pixels wide by 156 pixels high.

You can use your existing email addresses to post messages, and receive messages and summaries of group activities. In addition, a monthly account summary will be sent to your email addresses (see
Changing Your Message Notification Settings).
To use your existing email address, you must add it to the system. You can also remove an address, and change the list of default email address.
Unlike most fields, you can have multiple email addresses. To add an email address to the list of your addresses, carry out the following.

ol.li: View your profile (see Viewing Your Profile).
Click Change Email Settings. The Change Email Settings page will appear.
Type the new email address into the blank New address entry.
Click the Add Address button. You can now send messages from the newly added address to your groups on .

section.p: If the email address is used by another user, an error message will appear and the email address will not be added.
To remove an email address from the list of addresses in your profile, carry out the following.

ol.li: View your profile (see Viewing Your Profile).
Click Change Email Settings. The Change Email Settings page will appear.
Select the addresses you wish to remove from the list of email addresses.
Click the Remove Address button. The address will be removed from the Email Addresses list.

section.p: The last address cannot be removed, as you must have at least one email address.

section.h: Changing the Default Email Address or Addresses
section.p: To change where message notifications are sent by default, you can add a default email address or remove a default email address from the Default Email Addresses list.

To add an address to the list of default addresses, carry out the following tasks. (You cannot add an email address to the list of default addresses if all your email addresses are in the list of default addresses.)

ol.li: View your profile (see Viewing Your Profile).
Click Change Email Settings. The Change Email Settings page will appear.
Select an email address, or email addresses, from the Add Default Address list.
Click Add to Default.

section.p: To remove an email address from the default list of addresses that are used to notify you of posts, carry out the following. (You cannot reduce the list of default email addresses to fewer than one.)

ol.li: View your profile (see Viewing Your Profile).
Click Change Email Settings. The Change Email Settings page will appear.
Select the address from the Default Email Addresses list.
Click Remove from Default.

section.h: Viewing the Profile of Another User
section.p: To view the profile on another user on OnlineGroups.Net, carry out the following.

ol.li: Click on Members, on the homepage of a group (see Viewing a Group). The Members page, which lists all members of the selected group, will be shown.
Click on the name of the user whose profile you wish to view. The profile of that user will be shown.

section.p: Alternatively, click on a user's name in a message, and the profile for that person will be shown.

Groups are online areas where people collaborate on . As a registered user, you can join a group, leave a group, view a group or
change your message settings for the group.
You will need to join a group to post messages to it. To join a group, carry out the following.

ol.li: Log in to (see Logging In to ).
Click on Groups in the main navigation bar. The Groups page will be shown.
Click on the name of the group that you wish to join. The home-page for the selected group will be shown.

Click on Join. A message will be sent to your email account, informing you of your request to join a group: in most cases you will immediately belong to a group, but sometimes your request must be approved.

section.p: The Groups page and your profile will list all the groups that you belong to (see Viewing a Group and Viewing Your Profile).
To leave a group, carry out the following.

ol.li: View the group (see Viewing a Group).
Click Leave. You will receive a email message informing confirming that you have left the group.

section.p: Alternatively, follow the instructions that is placed in the footer of all email messages sent from that group.

Viewing a group allows you to see information about the group, including who belongs to the group and the messages that have been sent to the group. (The exact information that is visible can differ from group to group, and will depend on your group membership.) To view a group, carry out the following.

ol.li: Click Groups, in the main navigation bar, to show the Online Groups page.
Select a group from the My Groups or Other Groups lists. The page for the selected group will be shown.

section.p: Your profile also displays the My Groups list, which can be used to access groups.

section.h: Changing the Message Settings for a Group
section.p:
You can
change how you are notified of messages posted to a group and
change which email address notifications are sent to.
Carry out the following, to change how you are informed of messages posted to a group.

ol.li: Join the group (see Joining a Group).
View the group (see Viewing a Group).

Click Change your email settings, which is found in the Members section of the group homepage, or Email settings in the context-menu for the group. The Email Delivery Settings page for the group will be shown.
Select the desired notification option from the Message Notification list (see Message Notification Preferences).
Click the Change button.

tr.td: You will receive an email every time there is a post to the group.
You will receive an email that summarises the daily-activity in the group; if there is no activity for a week, then you will only receive a message at the end of the week.
You will not receive any email related to the group.

section.p: On the first day of each month, regardless of your message settings, you will be sent an email-reminder by OnlineGroups.Net that lists the groups you belong to, the message settings for each group, and how to leave the groups.
If you have multiple email addresses registered with (see Adding an Email Address), then you can change where email messages from a group are sent. To do this, carry out the following.

ol.li: Join the group (see Joining a Group).
View the group (see Viewing a Group).

Click Change your email settings, which is found in the Members section of the group homepage, or Email settings in the side-menu for the group. The Email Delivery Settings page for the group will be shown.

Select either of the following options.
Default Messages are sent to the default email addresses or addresses (see Setting the Default Email Address).
Specific Address or Addresses Messages are sent to the selected addresses that are listed below the Specific Address or Addresses option.
(If there is only one email address registered with , then the Email Addresses Used list will not be shown.)
Click the Change button.

section.p: You can participate online using by contacting other users, by working with messages, or by working with files.
Carry out the following tasks to contact other users.

ol.li: View the profile of the user that you wish to contact.
View the Email Addresses field.

Contact the user.
If the email addresses of the user are visible, click on an email address of the user and write the user a message in your normal email client.
If the email addresses of the user are not visible, click Request contact, which is also listed in the Email Address field of the user's profile. A message will be sent to the user that contains your email address and a statement that you wish to contact the user.

section.p: Messages form the basis of participation on . You can read messages that others have posted, create messages and link to messages.
You can read messages that are posted to groups by using the Web, by using email, or by using Web feeds.
To read a message that someone else has posted to a group, carry out the following.

ol.li: View the group (see Viewing a Group).

Either
Click on the name of a topic in the Current Topics list, which lists the five most active topics on the main page for the group, or
Click on View topics and click the name of a topic that is listed on the Topics page.
The page for the selected topic will be displayed. (If you are not a member of a group, you may not be able to see any topics.)

Scroll to view the messages, which are displayed from oldest (at the top) to newest. Alternatively, click on Jump to latest to view the most recent post, or use the Post Index list to jump to a particular post.

section.p:
Depending on your message settings for a group (see
Changing Your Message Notification Settings ) you will either be sent an email whenever a message is posted to the group, a digest of posts, or no email notification.

If configured, you will receive an email for each individual message that is posted to a group. Messages from can be identified by the subject that starts with the name of the group in square brackets, followed by the name of the topic. In addition, the message will be sent from an email account that is named after the group, such as example_group@onlinegroups.net.
The email message will contain the text of the post, and a link to the relevant group and topic. You can reply to the email to add a post to the group (see Posting a Message).

If configured, you will receive a message digest once a day. The message will be sent shortly after midnight, and can be identified by the subject line that will read [Example Group] Topic Digest, where Example Group will be replaced with the name of the group.

The message will summarise the postings in each of your groups, and provide links that can be followed to view the postings on OnlineGroups.Net. If you reply to a message digest you will be sent a summary of your profile; you cannot create a post from a message digest (see Creating Messages).

On , Web Feeds (often known as RSS Feeds and Live Bookmarks) provide summaries of the messages that are posted to groups. They can be viewed in an aggregator, such as Microsoft Internet Explorer 7, Mozilla Firefox and Apple Safari. Links to three feeds are provided, which summarise the notices, files and topics that have been posted, are linked of the homepage for the site. Consult the documentation for your aggregator on how to view a feed.
Messages can be created by either posting a message to an existing topic or by creating a new topic.

section.h: Posting a Message to an Existing Topic
section.p: You can post a message to an existing topic using the Web or using email.

section.h: Posting a Message using the Web
section.p: Carry out the following, to post a message to a topic using the Web.

ol.li: Log in to (see Logging In to ).
View the topic (see Reading Messages Using the Web).
Scroll to the bottom of the page, where the Add to the topic section is located.

Create your message.
Edit the text of your message in the Message entry.
Optionally, add tags to your message by writing them into the Tags entry. (See Tags.)
In addition, you may add a file along with your post (see Posting Files using the Web).
Click the Add button. Your message will be shown on the topic page, and will be sent to all group members who receive one email notification of posts.

section.p: (If you do not belong to the group, you cannot post messages to the group.)

A tag is a keyword, or category, that is associated with a post. You can associate multiple tags with a post when it is created; this should make the file easier for others to find (see
Reading Messages, and
Viewing Files).

Currently, tags can only be entered via the Web (see
Posting Messages and Posting Files). When entering a tag, they can be formatted in one of two ways.

dl.dd: The tags are separated by spaces, with quote-characters used to group words together, such as the following four tags: tags "example post" email message

di.dd: The tags are separated by commas, which also allow words to be grouped together, such as the following four tags: tags, example post, email, message

section.p:
To post a message to an existing topic using email, open a message that was posted to the topic (see Reading Email Posts) and reply; do not change the subject of the email message, as this will cause to create a new topic (see
Starting a New Topic Using Email). Once sent, the message will be added to the Topics page for the group, and be sent to all group members who receive email notification of posts.
Email attachments will be uploaded to the site. See the Posting Files Using Email section.
You can create a new topic for discussion, in any group that you are a member of, by using the Web or using email.

section.h: Starting a New Topic using the Web
section.p: To create a new topic using the Web, carry out the following.

ol.li: View the group (see Viewing a Group).

Click Start a new topic at the top of the Current Topics list, or at the top of the Topics page. The Start a New Topic page will be shown. (If you are not a member of a group you will not be able to create a new topic.)

Create your message.
Edit the text of your message in the Message entry.
Optionally, add tags to your message by writing them into the Tags entry. (See Tags.)
In addition, you may add a file along with your post (see Posting Files using the Web).
Click Start. The topic page will be created, and messages will be sent to all group members who wish to receive email notification of posts.

section.h: Starting a New Topic using Email
section.p: To create a topic using email, send a message to the email address for the group (such as example_group@onlinegroups.net) with the message subject set to the name of topic; do not use the name of an existing topic as this will cause the message to be added to the existing topic, rather than creating a new topic. If you are not a member of a group you cannot create a new topic, and you will be sent an error message informing you why you cannot post to the group. However, people who are not users will not receive error messages.

Sometimes it is useful to send someone a link to a post. To create a link, view the message you wish to link to (see Reading Messages Using the Web) and click short link, at the top of the message; the post will be shown on a single Web page. You can copy the address of the message from the location bar of your Web browser and paste it into any message you wish to send. If the recipient cannot view the post, because of inadequate permissions, then an error message will be shown when he or she tries and follow the link.
All documents, which are not messages, that are stored on are files. You can view files that others have posted, and post files to groups that you belong to.
Files can be viewed using the Web, and linked to using email.
To view a file using the Web, either

ul.li: View the topic that contains the file, or

Go to the Files area for the group by carrying out the following.
View the group (see Viewing a Group).
Click on Files. The Files Area for the group will be shown.
The ten most recently posted files will be listed. If the file you want is not listed, use the Items to Show, Age of File, Topic, and Tags fields to limit what files are shown.

section.p: Using either technique, when you have found the file, click the link to the file and your Web browser will allow you to view the file.
See also Reading Messages Using the Web.

If you have configured to send you an email whenever someone posts a message, you will also receive an email when a file is posted. The file is not attached to the email. Instead, you will receive a link to the file and a short description (see Viewing File Information). To view a file from an email, click on the link to the file that is contained in the email message, and your Web browser will allow you to view the file.

tr.td: The location of the file on . When viewed on the Web this becomes the link, which your browser follows when you click on the filename.
The name of the file that is posted.
The topic to which the file was posted.
The user name of the person who posted the file.
The tags associated with the file by the user who uploaded the file (see Tags).
The date the file was posted, in year-month-day format. (See G. Klyne and C. Newman, Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps, IETF, July 2002.)

section.p: Files can be posted on using the Web or using email.
To post files using the Web, carry out the following:

ol.li:
Either
Reply to a message in an existing topic (see
Posting a Message Using the Web), or
Create a new topic (see
Starting a New Topic Using the Web).
Click the Browse button and select a file in the file dialog, instead of (or in addition to) writing a message.
Click the Post button.

section.p: The file will be uploaded to and displayed under the relevant topic, and messages will be sent to all group members who wish to receive email notification of posts. Any tags that are set (see Tags) will be associated with the file, as well as the message that is sent.
To post files using email:

ol.li:
Either
Compose a reply to an email message without modifying the subject line (see
Posting a Message Using Email), or
Compose a new email message with a new subject line (see
Starting a New Topic Using Email).
Attach one or more files to your email message.
Send your email message.

section.p: The file/s will be uploaded to and displayed under the relevant topic. A link to each file will be included at the end of your email along with a short description.
